column4: I just got a belkin Usb transfer cable so me and my girlfriend can share files. Im on Kubuntu Gutsy and she's on Windows XP. Possible, or did we just waste money??
Are the two computers networked?
I have never done netwroking stuff in my life. The extent of my knowledge: we want to transfer files
Are the two machines physically connected?
Well this usb thing connects them....
That's not gonna work
but it said its a transfer cable for files o.o
How do the two computers connect to the internet
It would work if both machines used windows
oh. crap.
both are in a router
What are the IPs of each machine?
No offense, i dont give out IPs
In windows, do start --> run --> cmd --> ipconfig ; in ubuntu open a terminal and do ifconfig
What do we do with the info?
You said they're behind a router, which means they're not public IPs
You enable sharing on the windows box (ask ##windows) - and then use samba to connect to the windows box in ubuntu
Oh okay
In ubuntu, you'll go to places --> Network --> Go --> location --> and type smb://IP
I think it's native
In fact, I know it is -- it works off the live CD
Yes, smb://ip-of-other-machine
